thread.title: "Coming To America" Sequel Is Fake News, Eddie Murphy's Daughter Suggests
thread.title_full: "Coming To America" Sequel Is Fake News, Eddie Murphy's Daughter Suggests

author: Danielle Harling
title: "Coming To America" Sequel Is Fake News, Eddie Murphy's Daughter Suggests
text:
0 
Social media was abuzz this week when a verified Twitter account for actor/comedian Eddie Murphy sent out the following tweet: “Coming to America sequel ?” 
TMZ confirmed the possibility of a sequel to the classic flick, reporting that a source revealed Murphy was “in the early writing stages of the project” and is “still tinkering with the plot.” 
Unfortunately for fans of the 1988 rom-com, rumors of a sequel appear to be just that. 
Earlier today (March 17), Murphy’s daughter, Bria Murphy uploaded a screenshot of a text conversation with her father. In the convo, Bria questions her dad about his Coming To America tweet, and it’s clear that the actor is fully unaware of any Twitter account. 
“Twitter account? What Twitter account? I have a Twitter account?” Murphy texts in response to his daughter’s inquiry. A post shared by Bria Murphy (@bria_murphy) on Mar 16, 2017 at 11:00pm PDT 
Additionally, a search of the @eddiemurphy Twitter account now yields a “Sorry, that page doesn’t exist!” error message. 
TMZ did report that Murphy’s page is run by a social media team, and the tweet/account may have been deleted because someone jumped the gun on the Coming To America sequel news. 
Eddie Murphy has yet to comment publicly on the matter. Subscribe to DX Newsletter Get The Most Important Stories Of The Day Straight To Your Inbox Thank You! Thank You! Thank You!
